lines.content: * Entry point of the Spaceman application which serves as a personal assistance chat-bot.
* Initializes the application and starts the interaction with the user.
* Sets up the required objects and loads up the data from the storage file.
* @param filePath path of the file used to store data
* Reads the user command and executes it, until the user issues the "bye" command.
* This method continuously prompts the user for commands and executes them until the user enters "bye".
* Adds a task into the list of tasks.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks) throws InvalidActionException;
* Deletes a task from the list of tasks.
* Finds and lists all the tasks that contains the keyword.
public void execute(TaskList tasks) throws InvalidActionException {

* Marks a specific task in the list as done.

private static final String DATE_TIME_PATTERN1 = "\\d{1,2}/\\d{1,2}/\\d{4}\\s+\\d{4}"; // dd/mm/yyyy 1500
private static final String DATE_TIME_PATTERN2 = "\\d{4}/\\d{1,2}/\\d{1,2}\\s+\\d{4}"; // yyyy/mm/dd 1500
private static final String DATE_TIME_PATTERN3 = "\\d{1,2}-\\d{1,2}-\\d{4}\\s+\\d{4}"; // dd-mm-yyyy 1500
private static final String DATE_TIME_PATTERN4 = "\\d{4}-\\d{1,2}-\\d{1,2}\\s+\\d{4}"; // yyyy-mm-dd 1500
* Returns the {@link Command} inputted by the user.

* @throws IncompleteDescriptionException If user input is incomplete.

public static Todo parseTodo(String arguments) throws IncompleteDescriptionException {

public static int parseTaskIndex(String arguments) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {

* Encode task status to integers to be stored in the storage data file.
* A task marked as done is stored as 1, while a task marked as not done is stored as 0.

* @return integer indicator of the task status
* Converts the task details to a String to be stored in the storage data file.

* Container for user-visible messages used in the application.
* These messages are used to provide feedback and information to the user.
public static final String MESSAGE_BYE = "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
public static final String MESSAGE_UNKNOWN = "☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(";
public static final String MESSAGE_MARK = "Nice! I've marked this task as done:";
public static final String MESSAGE_UNMARK = "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:";
public static final String MESSAGE_EMPTY_TODO = "☹ OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.";
public static final String MESSAGE_EMPTY_DEADLINE = "☹ OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.";
public static final String MESSAGE_EMPTY_BY = "☹ OOPS!!! The /by parameter of a deadline cannot be empty.";
public static final String MESSAGE_EMPTY_EVENT = "☹ OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.";
public static final String MESSAGE_EMPTY_FROM = "☹ OOPS!!! The /from parameter of an event cannot be empty.";
public static final String MESSAGE_EMPTY_TO = "☹ OOPS!!! The /to parameter of an event cannot be empty.";
public static final String MESSAGE_INVALID_DATE = "☹ OOPS!!! The format of the date is invalid.";
public static final String MESSAGE_INVALID_INDEX = "☹ OOPS!!! This is an invalid task index.";
* Represents the user interface (UI) of the application.
* This class is responsible for reading user input and displaying output to the user.
* It provides methods for reading user input and printing messages to the screen.
* Shows the welcome message upon starting the program.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Shows the goodbye message before the program terminates.
System.out.println("Now you have " + Task.getTaskCount() + " tasks in the list.");
* Shows message after a task is successfully added.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
* Shows message after a task is successfully removed.
* Shows a list of current tasks to the user.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
